intro: Hemitelia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Hemitelia hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
